resources.string: Below is a list of features
Select Detail List button on Main Page to view Canada Zones
Select Safety Procedure button on Main Page to view helpful websites on Air Quality Indexes
Select Glossary button on Main Page to view terminologies related to Air Quality Indexes
To Search for an Air Quality Index; select a Zone on Detail List button then select a Region
To Search for a helpful website; select any of the links in Safety Procedure page

AirQualityIndex Application displays air quality indexes from various Canada location. Each location consists of a zone with many regions within a zone. The user may select a region to view the todays observation and forecasts for tonight and tomorrow.
This application is created to demonstrate open source datasets from the Canadian government. The sole purpose for this application is for educational purpose.

string-array.item: Six key air pollutants are ozone,fine particulate matter, nitrogen dioxide, sulphur dioxide, carbon monoxide, total reduced sulphur compounds
The Air Quality Index (AQI) is a rating scale for outdoor air in Ontario. The lower the AQI, the better the air quality.
O3 is a colourless, odourless gas at ambient concentrations and is a major component of smog.
SO2 is a colourless gas. It smells like burnt matches. It can be oxidized to sulphur trioxide, which in the presence of water vapour is readily transformed to sulphuric acid mist.
Particulate matter is characterized according to size - mainly because of the different health effects associated with particles of different diameters
